etymologies: early 20th century: from modern Latin Chalicotherium (genus name), from Greek khalix, khalik- ‘gravel’ + thērion ‘wild animal’

definitions: a large horse-like fossil mammal of the late Tertiary period, with stout claws on the toes rather than hoofs.

notes.text: Family Chalicotheriidae, order Perissodactyla: several genera, in particular Moropus

shortDefinitions: large horselike fossil mammal of late Tertiary period
